intro: Condaminea, commonly known as the ghost orchid, is a rare and elusive flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a terrestrial orchid with a unique appearance, featuring a single, delicate white or pale green flower that resembles a ghostly face. The plant has a short, slender stem and lacks true leaves, relying instead on its roots for photosynthesis. Condaminea thrives in shaded, moist environments, often growing on the bases of trees or in dense undergrowth. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
